alert.note: Alert for Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 01 at 5:58AM MDT until October 01 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following area, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From noon MDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Repeated rounds of fast-moving, but strong storms may lead to locally heavy rainfall and excessive runoff. The Hermits Peak Calf Canyon burn scar will be especially vulnerable to runoff and potential flash flooding given the heavy rainfall that occurred on Saturday. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
